definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

sentences.english: On the other hand, Christian monotheism was an innovation.
sentences.chinese: 在另一方面，基督教一神论，是一种创新。

sentences.english: What is so new and revolutionary about monotheism?
But they have common antecedents in Greek and Roman civilisation and monotheistic Christianity.
sentences.chinese: 但它们都源于希腊与罗马文明，以及一神论的基督教。

sentences.english: But monotheism was judged to be the best and purest form of religion.
sentences.chinese: 而一神论则被认为是最好最纯净的宗教形式。

sentences.english: Mummy of Egypt's monotheist pharaoh to return home .
sentences.chinese: 埃及一神论法老木乃伊即将返回故土。

sentences.english: His monotheistic solution resolves the old strict dualism.
sentences.chinese: 他的一神论解决方案解答了古老的严格二元论。

sentences.english: It is, I should say, a 'monotheistic but "sub-creational" mythology'.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个“一神论”但包括“次创造”的神话。

sentences.english: God-based societies will spring up theistic thinking.
sentences.chinese: 以神为根基的社会将涌现一神论的思想。

sentences.english: And yet you believe in a monotheistic universe? No room for one than one god in your world.
sentences.chinese: 但你却崇信一神论？你的世界里容不下另一位上帝。

definition: pantheism, theological theory equating God with the Universe
theism (the belief in the existence of God)
deism, theological theory of God who does not interfere in the Universe
dualism, belief that the universe is made of two different substance (e.g. mind and matter or good and evil)

pinyin: Suo3 luo2 ya4 si1 de2 jiao4
